title: Citi Expands China Network, Opens Branch in Nanjing
summary: Nanjing – Citibank (China) Co., Ltd. ("Citi China") today conducted a ceremony to mark its arrival in the city of Nanjing. The full-service branch is Citi's 11th in China, and offers a range of Renminbi and foreign currency products and services to multinational and local companies, Chinese residents and foreign nationals. Stephen Bird, Chief Executive Officer, Citi Asia Pacific and Andrew Au, Chief Executive Officer of Citi China, attended the opening ceremony.
tag-1: Citi Expands China Network, Opens Branch in Nanjing
tag-3: Nanjing – Citibank (China) Co., Ltd. ("Citi China") today conducted a ceremony to mark its arrival in the city of Nanjing. The full-service branch is Citi's 11th in China, and offers a range of Renminbi and foreign currency products and services to multinational and local companies, Chinese residents and foreign nationals. Stephen Bird, Chief Executive Officer, Citi Asia Pacific and Andrew Au, Chief Executive Officer of Citi China, attended the opening ceremony.
tag-4: Stephen Bird said: "In 2011, Citi continues to perform strongly, and this is certainly the case for our business in China. We have excellent momentum in China, and are well positioned for future success. I am delighted we are open for business in the dynamic city of Nanjing."
tag-5: Andrew Au said: "Opening a branch in Nanjing, one of China's key commercial centers, marks an important milestone for Citi. We believe we have the right people, the most innovative and customer-centric services, and the global network to compete strongly in Nanjing. We look forward to serving institutions and individuals in Nanjing with the best of everything they need in banking."
tag-6: Citi China has a diverse base of institutional clients and has a strong track record in helping Chinese companies achieving their strategic goals. Bankers at the Nanjing branch will work closely with leading companies based in the city, including small and medium-sized enterprises, large local corporations as well as multinational companies doing business in Nanjing. Corporate banking services offered at the branch include cash management, trade finance and services, loans and syndication, FX transactions, project finance and structured finance and other financial products.
tag-7: The Nanjing branch also represents Citibank's 36th outlet in China. The branch offers both Citibank and Citigold services, and is the latest state-of-the-art Smart Banking outlet opened by Citibank in China.
tag-8: Anand Selva, Country Business Manager of Citibank China, said, "China is a key market for investment in innovation by Citibank. This Smart Banking outlet gives Nanjing consumers a new style of retail banking, which we believe will provide a superior customer service experience."
tag-9: Key technology and services offered to retail customers include:
tag-10: The Nanjing branch houses 21 corporate bankers and 42 retail banking professionals. It is located at World Trade Center, No. 2, Han Zhong Road, Nanjing.
tag-11: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Through Citicorp and Citi Holdings, Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
